Nexmo Installation Guide

1 - Overview

This document covers the technical details, installation and configuration about the Nexmo driver application. We can configure the nexmo application on the existing instance. By using this application we can make a call easily.

1.1 - References

Twilio Direct Configuration

2 - Application Dependencies

Notify and Action Status Automation plugins Numbers, Number group and Calls table

3 - Configuration Instructions

Go to "nexmo config" table and enter the nexmo application "API key and API secret,.." details to create a new application in the nexmo site. (click the "connect" button for creation) Now, buy a new number on the nexmo site and link that number to the newly created application, in Nexmo Dashboard. In Service now, edit the "Nexmo Config" table list and click the "Nexmo Phone Number" button to fetch and store the nexmo linked numbers on the numbers table. Go to "Number group" table and created a new group by using the "Nexmo Demo Call" work-flow and then add that Number group to the Numbers table for the Nexmo numbers. (https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/london-servicenow-platform/page/product/notify2/task/t_CreateANumberGroup.html)

4 - External Systems Connection

In Nexmo Dashboard, we have to buy a new number and link that number to the newly created application after submitting the configure details on the Nexmo Config page.

5 - Testing the Configuration

Navigate to Studio->Nexmo Driver application->"Nexmo Call" table and enter the phone number to make a call to that number. The call and DTMF details will store on the calls table in Notify.

6 - Demo Data

No need to import the demo data in the ServiceNow for the Nexmo Application. Just, we have to register with Nexmo and add credit to the Nexmo Account.
